simulator

Interface SystemTimer


  • public interface SystemTimer
    A SystemTimer (i) provides support for simulated time, and (ii) support for the setting of timeout interrupts by kernel code.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancelInterrupt(int processID)
      Cancel timer interrupt for given process ID.
      long getIdleTime()
      Obtain the amount of time the CPU has been idle.
      long getKernelTime()
      Obtain the amount of time the system has spent executing in kernel space.
      long getSystemTime()
      Obtain the current system time.
      long getUserTime()
      Obtain the amount of time the system has spent executing in user space.
      void scheduleInterrupt(int timeUnits, InterruptHandler handler, java.lang.Object... varargs)
      Schedule a timer interrupt for timeUnits time units in the future.

    • Method Detail

      • getSystemTime

        long getSystemTime()
        Obtain the current system time.

      • getIdleTime

        long getIdleTime()
        Obtain the amount of time the CPU has been idle.

      • getUserTime

        long getUserTime()
        Obtain the amount of time the system has spent executing in user space.

      • getKernelTime

        long getKernelTime()
        Obtain the amount of time the system has spent executing in kernel space.

      • scheduleInterrupt

        void scheduleInterrupt(int timeUnits,
                       InterruptHandler handler,
                       java.lang.Object... varargs)
        Schedule a timer interrupt for timeUnits time units in the future. The given handler receives a call back when it occurs.

      • cancelInterrupt

        void cancelInterrupt(int processID)
        Cancel timer interrupt for given process ID.
